comment: I won't lie, Dr. Green's CVA lecture is probably one of the most interesting classes I've taken at KSU! 10/10 lectures, and he lets YOU grade your tests lol. Literally show up to class, make an effort, and I promise you'll end with an A :) Good luck!
None of the videos made sense. I would not recommend taking.

As someone who is not a fan of test-heavy courses, this one was fine as he allows you to grade yourself, meaning you can potentially get a higher grade than what you earned on a test as long as you justify it sufficiently. There is a lot of content for this course but he makes it manageable and interesting. Lab is dissection-heavy.
rating_tags: Group projects--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Absolutely love love love Dr.G!! His lectures were actually quite interesting, & I actually found myself interested in what he was teaching. His labs were also fun, & easy to understand. He explains/teaches everything so well, and I love that he has video references for everything. Definitely take him!! For me, the lecture exams were a bit hard

CVA is a useful & interesting class for bio majors looking to learn more about body systems in the context of phylogeny and evolution. Dr. Green is very educated on the subject & wants the best for his students. Group research project is kind of fun. Overall, a great professor with clear criteria, so you always know what to expect.

Dr. Green is a very nice guy and very willing to help. 2 midterm exams 1 cumulative final with a lot of lab assignments and one big group lab project. He records lectures and is entertaining during them. Labs are not usually 3 hours but some are during the semester. He gives no extra credit and does not curve exams, that is one downside, however.

I enjoy Dr. Greens class. I had some personal problems so I havent been attending class but hes been very understanding and despite these problems, Ive still managed to make As and Bs on the tests. Lots of labs but they arent too difficult. Tests are hard but if you study your lecture notes youll be fine. Hes a really nice guy & good teacher
